wikipedia_page.main: George Vicesimus Wigram (28 March 1805 – 1 February 1879) was an English biblical scholar and theologian.

response: Wigram's eldest brother, Robert (1773–1843), was a Director of the Bank of England and a Tory Member of Parliament who in 1832 changed his name from Wigram to Fitzwygram. Their other brothers included Joseph Cotton Wigram (1798–1867), Bishop of Rochester, Loftus Tottenham Wigram QC (1803–89), a barrister and politician, and the theologian George Vicesimus Wigram (1805–79).William Courthope, Debrett's Complete Peerage of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland (1838), p. 605
* George Wigram, that is George Vicesimus Wigram (1805–1879)  English biblical scholar and theologian
* Frances "Fanny" Bligh (d. 1834), who married George Vicesimus Wigram, son of Sir Robert Wigram, 1st Baronet, in 1830.
